newsitem.title: FRANCE: Reuters French Advertising & Media Digest - May 22.
newsitem.headline: Reuters French Advertising & Media Digest - May 22.

text.p: REUTERS FRENCH ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST
News from Reuters and the French press on Advertising, Marketing, Media, the Internet and Brand-name Products.
ADVERTISING & MARKETING:
PARIS - French nuclear power plant maker Framatome is to run an advertising campaign devised by Devarrieux-Villaret, which will promote nuclear power as benefitting the environment. (Le Figaro)
PARIS - French advertising agency Euro RSCG says it won the European advertising account for Haagen-Dazs ice-cream.
(Reuter)
PARIS - Promotion by candidates in the upcoming French elections has been short, poorly-financed and thin on interest, advertising industry specialists say. (Reuter)
PARIS - Jean-Michel Carlo, vice-president of Havas Advertising, plans to cut the number of its subsidiaries. They could be reduced from 26 to around 10 in a quest for efficiency. (Le Figaro)
MEDIA & THE INTERNET:
PARIS - French socialist leader Lionel Jospin plans to propose a new broadcasting bill if his party wins the French parliamentary elections. (Le Figaro)
PARIS - Pathe is to buy thematic television channel Voyage, wholly-owned by U.S. Landmark Communication Inc. (Le Figaro)

PARIS - Canal Plus is negotiating a compromise with Italy's telecommunications operator Stet and television company Rai and over shareholdings in pay television firm Telepiu, to avoid the threat that they would launch a competitor to Telepiu. (Les Echos)

PARIS - Lyonnaise Cable is to launch a digital decoder throughout France on June 2 which would allow its subscribers to receive competing digital services Canalsatellite and TPS on the same decoder. (Les Echos)
PARIS - Le Parisien, Le Monde and Le Figaro are fighting to be the top selling national daily. Le Monde and Le Figaro are also considering broadcasting ventures. (La Tribune)
BRAND NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS:

PARIS - Rexel, part of French distribution group Pinault-Printemps-Redoute, says it has bought 100 percent of Italy's Elfin from U.S. Chemco Electric Supply and 100 percent of Portugal'a Tecnitel. (Reuter)
PARIS - French carmaker Renault says it is selling its 0.9 percent holding in oil company Elf Aquitaine. (Reuter)
PARIS - A French court orders SNCF French railways to pay two anti-smoking groups 5,000 francs ($870) each in damages for its failure to crack down on smokers in a Paris train station.
(Reuter)
Paris Editorial, Sue Landau
